title: Test: Autoload Package
text:
This webpage tests the autoload-packages key meta option by not loading the requested packages.

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: Test: Setup Cell with Packages for Interactive
text:
The following hidden cell should setup a ggplot2 theme and set variables:

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.
The next cell should handle graphing values with a theme being set:

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.
crumbs: Test: Setup Cell with Packages for Interactive

title: Test: Chained Non-interactive Areas
text:
Important



We’ve slowed down each cell’s execution time by about 1/4 of a second to show how the document is responding.



Package dependencies
The quarto-webr extension is set to automatically install and load the ggplot2 and dplyr packages by specifying a packages key in the document’s header.


Setup a hidden ggplot2 object
From there, we’re going to use the context: setup hidden cell to create a ggplot2 object that uses the mtcars data set with the aesthetic mappings of x = wt and y = mpg called g.

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.


Generate a graph
Let’s move from setup to generating and displaying results by using g object created in setup within an output context:

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.


Re-use prior graph object
Let’s also re-use the base g but change the aesthetics so that colour is now present.

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.


Expose the setup object
Finally, let’s make sure we can do some interesting things with the interactive session.






Note



Changes inside of interactive cells do not propagate backwards in the document.



Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: Test: Load and Use Packages used in Context
text:
This document disables autoloading of the packages and manually loads the package inside of the context output.

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.
Next, we should be able to retrieve the prior cells value

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: quarto-webr Test Website
text:
Welcome
Welcome to the test suite website for the quarto-webr. This website is meant to examine how different features of the extension are working or not working across different browsers.

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: Test: Service Worker with Version

title: Test: Repos package key
text:
This document tests the repos key meta option by attempting to download a package demorwasmbinary from a custom repository at:
https://tutorials.thecoatlessprofessor.com/webr-unified-gh-workflow/
And, then, falls back on the main webR repository for a second package visualize.

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

title: Test: Keyboard Shortcuts in Code cell
text:
This is a webr-enabled code cell in a Quarto HTML document.

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.

Run selected code using either:

macOS: ⌘ + ↩︎/Return
Windows/Linux: Ctrl + ↩︎/Enter

Run the entire code by clicking the “Run code” button or pressing Shift+↩︎.
